Assigns the contents to the regular expression.

@1@ Assigns the contents of {{c|other}}. {{lc|flags()}} and {{lc|mark_count()}} are equivalent to the values of {{c|other.flags()}} and {{c|other.mark_count()}} after the call.

@2@ Assigns the contents of {{c|other}} using move semantics. {{lc|flags()}} and {{lc|mark_count()}} are equivalent to the values of {{c|other.flags()}} and {{c|other.mark_count()}} before the assignment. After the call, {{c|other}} is in a valid, but unspecified state.

@3-7@ Assigns a sequence of characters to the regular expression. The syntax flags are set to {{tt|f}}. {{lc|mark_count()}} returns the number of marked subexpressions within the resulting subexpression after the call.

:@3@ Assigns a null-terminated string pointed to by {{c|s}}.
:@4@ Assigns a sequence of {{c|count}} characters, pointed to by {{c|s}}.
:@5@ Assigns the string {{c|str}}.
:@6@ Assigns the characters in the range {{range|first|last}}.
:@7@ Assigns the characters in the initializer list {{c|ilist}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|other|another regular expression to assign}}
{{par|s|pointer to a character sequence to assign}}
{{par|str|string to assign}}
{{par|first, last|the range of characters to assign}}
{{par|ilist|initializer list containing characters to assign}}
{{par hreq}}
{{par req named|InputIt|InputIterator}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|*this}}

===Exceptions===
@1@ {{cpp/impldef exception item}}

@3-7@ {{lc|std::regex_error}} if the supplied regular expression is not valid. The object is not modified in that case.
